title: Topic 001 Question 321
body: A company runs a global ecommerce website that is hosted on AWS. The company uses Amazon CloudFront to serve content to its user base. The company wants to block inbound traffic from a specific set of countries to comply with recent data regulation policies.
Which solution will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
options: Create an AWS WAF web ACL with an IP match condition to deny the countries' IP ranges. Associate the web ACL with the CloudFront distribution.
Create an AWS WAF web ACL with a geo match condition to deny the specific countries. Associate the web ACL with the CloudFront distribution.
Use the geo restriction feature in CloudFront to deny the specific countries.
Use geolocation headers in CloudFront to deny the specific countries.
